heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) (Amendment) (No. 2) (Assessment of 
Means) Regulations 2023. 

(2) These Regulations 

(Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 to 2023 shall be 
construed together as one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 to 2023. 

the Social Welfare 

and 

Calculation of means

title: Schedule 3, to the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent of
heading: 2. Article 36 (amended by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
2. Article 36 (amended by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) (Amendment) (No. 1) (Calculation of 
Means) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 161 of 2023)) of the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 
412 of 2007) is amended by the insertion of the following paragraph after 
paragraph (dc): 

“(dd) any amount to a maximum of €7,000.00 per annum from 
payments made by UCD’s Cothrom na Féine Scholarship 
Programme.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 10th November, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the foregoing Regulations. 

[534] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 October, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

31 October, 2023. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [534]

title: Schedule 3, to the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide that a scholarship payment to a maximum of 
€7000.00 per annum paid by UCD’s Cothrom na Féine Scholarship 
Programme to a person will be disregarded in the means test for supplementary 
welfare allowance payments. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [534] 5
